Schedule

Welcome Drinks + Rehearsal Dinner

Friday June 13, 6:00pm

The C'mon Inn, Riley's Grandfather's house
View on Map
Attire
Caftans & Denim cut-off casual. Bring or wear your suit for a dip in the Atlantic.

After our quick dress-less rehearsal, we’ll meet you over on Pop Pop’s lawn. We’ve spent countless summer evenings here soaking up the postcard sunsets while devouring local nosh and throwing back some Red Stripe. We’ve got the Turf Truck serving up our favorite heirloom radish salad, lobster rolls and honey-fried chicken, with enough beer to sink a ship. Last moonrise as Hadley & Muller, let us howl!/Counting on you to help us make a dent!

Ceremony

Saturday June 14, 6:00pm

The Magic Garden, Ruschmeyer's
View on Map
Attire
Summertime fly. We invited you, stylish comrades, for a reason./ A linen suit would be right at home next to your dates breezy silk chiffon, but don't let us sway your swag/ If complementary colors are your thing, we'll be decking the aisles with buttery yellow, sunrise orange and sage green.

Although the courthouse will have our signatures on the dotted line, we know it won’t be real in our eyes until you help us make the commitment. After some lip-locking, a Pablo Neruda poem and the string-quartet version of `Into the Mystic,’ we think the deal will be sealed.

Reception

Saturday June 14, 7:30pm

Stay where you are! /Ruschmeyer's
View on Map
Attire
After that show of love, you may be tempted to de-robe just a little/Bow tie optional, Dancing shoes required.

No need to front, this is what we all have been waiting for. Enjoy a margarita or glass of prosecco at the Electric Eel while wifey & hubby (wait, us?) snap some photos in the teepee, then gather back ‘round in the garden for a lantern-lit fiesta

Brunch

Sunday June 15, 11:00am

The Pool, Sole East
View on Map
Attire
Whatever is left in your luggage. We may be in bath robes, anyway.

We’re all going to feel like we were hit by a tractor trailer truck that was hauling 150 cases of Moet, but according to history we will live to see work on Monday. With that in mind, let’s have two fried eggs, buttery toast and a bloody mary to carry us over.
